text: When life forces us to do something impossible,
an explosion happens inside the body.
The rush of hormones blast through us,
- making us stronger. - What the hell?
Making us faster.
Biology overrides fear, and that makes the impossible, possible.
Okay, so either this is a drill, or it's a real fire!
If it's a real fire, then it probably has something to do
with the guy, so I vote drill.
Despite that large boom you just heard? Really?
All right, fine. It's the guy. The bad, escaped rapist guy!
Why? Why?
Oh, door's unlocked!
Well yeah, a fire would override a lockdown.
I gotta go find Stephanie.
Just be careful!
The entryway is closed, ma'am.
I just watched an explosion up there!
And I already reported it. The hospital is on lock down.
- Did you see that? - Something exploded up there.
- This entrance way will remain closed! - East South,
possibly in the South wing, four, five floors up!
- That's right near the NICU. - And the CCU, Yeah!
- We have to get in there! - We need to get in there!
- Hey! - They won't let us in!
They're clear to come in. I need their help.
- There's a lockdown! - I ordered the damn lockdown!
Fire in the hospital trumps rapist on the loose.
They are cleared!
- There's a rapist on the loose? - Where have you been?
We have a multiple-alarm fire on floors five and six
from the service elevators east.
We are concerned about the structural damage on that floor.
We're diverting all incoming traumas.
Patients in immediate or impending danger need to be evacuated first.
Unaffected areas, the ER, radiology, nursery, daycare. They stay put.
We have to prioritize.
Firefighter Carroll here will be directing you to the most urgent areas.
And, uh, the woman with her arm in the air, over there is Dr. Kepner.
She is setting up the holding area,
- Outside by parking lot one. - By parking lot one.
Take evacuated patients to her. She is in charge.
And if your patients can walk, they can transport themselves.
Okay, thank you, Dr. Grey. Do not be a hero. If they can walk, let them walk.
Carry the rest. The elevators are not working.
- Do not try and use them. - Work fast, but work safe.
Our man's still at large, so we're maintaining security at the exits,
and we're keeping active sweeping.
Because just one hospital emergency wasn't enough.
Lord, don't make me have to tell Catherine Avery I burned
- her hospital to the ground. - Edwards!
Stephanie!
Edwards!
Go, go, go, go. Stephanie?
Maggie! Hey, take this to Kepner outside.

They're trying to contain it near the CCU,
but I heard it spread to the O.R. floor.

No, no, and don't go thinking he's been burnt to a fiery crisp.

I'm legit! I swear!
High alert in progress, sir. I need to see some I.D.
I don't have it. My wife has my wallet.
Look, our baby's upstairs for observation.

You gotta help me. I've looked everywhere.
I went... I checked the cafeteria, the gift shop.

My daughter, Erin. She's missing again.

Help me!
Stephanie!
Help!

Erin! Erin, where are you?

I thought you were gone!

Hang on!

You'll be fine, all right?
You're just gonna get a bit of fresh air, all right?

Okay, these two very capable doctors are going to carry you down.
Carry?
Yeah, you're gonna have your own personal escort.

- Like Cleopatra. - Exactly!
Okay, hurry up! Okay, this place is full.

Come on, let's go.
Oh. Just finished alerting all dispatchers to divert
their traumas. Do you need hands here?
Absolutely.
Hey, you guys seen Edwards anywhere?

Yes, yes. The rapist guy in the hospital.
That's her patient. She's with him somewhere.

Did you alert police about Edwards?
No, no, good idea. Can you do that?
- I... - Thank you!
- We need all hands on deck, Avery! Let him go.
Doctor Webber, there's a protocol when it comes to this.

And yes, the police are also looking for her.
Then maybe we should let the cops do their jobs. We focus on patients.
Okay, listen. She likes to run and hide.
She has brownish hair. Her name is Erin.

Look, I'll be fine, Dr. Minnick.
Would you let the police know we have a resident missing? Will you?
Okay, the kids are asleep, so it should be easy.
Ellis is just getting over a bug, so when she wakes up,
just take her temp.
We are gonna be on the road for the next

Hey, uh, you might wanna eat something.

Okay, no. We have to go. It's gonna take a few hours to drive

And we have to be there when your sister lands.
Yeah.
They suggested you might want to bring photographs

Right. Right, because she might not remember.
You know what? You stay here. I'm gonna go to the house

Erin, don't be scared! Just hang on!
All right, Erin?
Okay.

Is he gone? Is that man gone?
Uh, yeah, yeah. He's very, very gone. You keep your face low, okay?
You keep your face low and stay as far away from the fire as you can!
I can't. I can't. My leg, it's stuck.
Okay, don't worry. Uh, I'm coming, don't panic.

No, no, honey, it's keeping all the blood in your leg.
It hurts.

Okay.
Okay. You... You lucked out, missy. 'Cause I am...

I do this kind of stuff in my sleep.
Okay. All right. We're gonna figure this out.
Okay? Right? Just you and me. Right?

Okay!
God! Hey, it's okay, it's okay, it's okay. I got you. I got you, okay?
- All right? Lie back. - Okay.
Just lie back.
Relax as much as you can.
You know, when I was a kid, I was in the hospital a lot,
and, uh... they would have to...
- Ow, ow. - Oh, it's okay! I'm sorry.
They would do a bunch of stuff that hurt me too. And I hated it.
I hated it. So, do you know what I would do?
Ah!

Real tight, tight as I could.
- Mm-hm. - Sometimes, my, uh, nails would dig into my hands.
And I would even break the skin sometimes, but it helped.
The more I thought about my hands,
the less I thought about anything else. And sometimes,
I would just scream my head off. And it would drive my doctors crazy,
but it made me feel better.
- Okay. Okay. - Okay?
All right, Erin.
Look, what I'm about to do is really going to hurt, Erin.

Okay. Here we go.

Are you okay?
Yes. Yeah, yeah. Not a big fan of fire. You know?
If I'm being honest, it's kinda my worst nightmare, actually.

Just take a minute. Okay? Just take a minute. We...
No, no. I'm good. I'm good.

Oh, Pierce! Can you come take a look?
- Hi. - Hi.
- Hi. - Hi.
The chest sounds good.
Those handsome boys treated me like a queen.

We're gonna get you attached to an EKG machine. Okay?
Hey, you didn't happen to see Jackson in there, did you?

Yeah, he ran into a burning bus once to save a child.

Do you not hear the alarm? The fire is on the floor above us.

Well, you're right. You can't walk away from the patient.

Sir, I have a man's lung in my hand.

You will... when you see her.
You'll know what to say when you see her.

but it will... when you see her.
